alert.note: Alert for Butte; Harding; Northern Meade Co Plains; Perkins; Ziebach (South Dakota) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.senderName: NWS RapidCity (Western South Dakota and Northeastern Wyoming)
info.headline: Blizzard Warning issued December 21 at 3:42PM MST until December 23 at 5:00AM MST by NWS RapidCity
info.description: ...EXTREME COLD AND DANGEROUS WIND CHILLS WILL CONTINUE THROUGH FRIDAY... ...TRAVEL IMPACTS DUE TO BLOWING SNOW THROUGH FRIDAY... .Snowfall today with a quick moving system will exit the area by early this evening. However, gusty winds will persist across much of the area through early Friday, with the strongest winds developing late tonight through Thursday evening. The combination of wind and freshly fallen snowfall will result in blowing snow and blizzard or near blizzard conditions at times across the northwest into west central South Dakota plains. Areas of blowing snow can be expected elsewhere on the plains, with reduced visibilities at times, especially on Thursday. Dangerously cold wind chills will continue over western South Dakota and northeastern Wyoming through the week. The coldest wind chills are expected tonight through Friday morning, with values of 30 below to near 60 below zero in most areas through Friday morning. ...BLIZZARD WARNING REMAINS IN EFFECT UNTIL 5 AM MST FRIDAY... ...WIND CHILL WARNING REMAINS IN EFFECT UNTIL 5 PM MST FRIDAY... * WHAT...For the Blizzard Warning, blizzard conditions expected at times due to blowing snow. Winds gusting as high as 50 mph, especially on Thursday. For the Wind Chill Warning, dangerously cold wind chills. Wind chills as low as 55 below zero. * WHERE...Harding County, Perkins County, Butte County, the Northern Meade County Plains and Ziebach County. This includes the Tribal Lands of the Cheyenne River Reservation. * WHEN...For the Wind Chill Warning, until 5 PM MST Friday. For the Blizzard Warning, until 5 AM MST Friday. * IMPACTS...Plan on slippery road conditions. Widespread blowing snow could significantly reduce visibility. Gusty winds could bring down tree branches. The dangerously cold wind chills could cause frostbite on exposed skin in as little as 5 minutes.
info.instruction: A Blizzard Warning means the combination of snow, blowing snow, and strong winds will create dangerous whiteout conditions. A Wind Chill Warning means the combination of wind and cold temperatures will create dangerously low wind chill values. Even if you are outdoors for just a few minutes, cover all parts of your body, especially your head, face, and hands. Road conditions are available on your smartphone from the 5 1 1 app for your state.

area.areaDesc: Butte; Harding; Northern Meade Co Plains; Perkins; Ziebach
